This Guide describes how to use the Remus audiostore, and how it is structured.
Overview
Introduction
The Remus audiostore is a structured storage of audio files, providing automated sorting and searching. It can store files in various formats, including MP3 and Ogg/Vorbis, and perform searches on them provided they have appropriate tags.
The storage is implemented as a combination of file system storage (the audio files) and a &app.mysql; database (the metadata, such as title and artist), and provides both a programmatic interface (currently in &app.python;) and a &std.webdav; interface for browser access.
